member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Gpio.GpioChangeCount
member.summary: Represents a near-simultaneous sampling of the number of times a pin has changed value, and the time at which this count was sampled. This structure can be used to determine the number of pin value changes over a period of time.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Gpio.GpioChangeCount.Count
member.summary: The number of times the transition of polarity specified by GpioChangeCounter.Polarity occured on the pin.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Gpio.GpioChangeCount.RelativeTime
member.summary: The time at which this count was sampled. The time is sampled close to (but not simultaneously with) the count. This timestamp can be used to determine the elapsed time between two GpioChangeCount records. It does not correspond to any absolute or system time.

member.summary: Creates a new GpioChangeCounter associated with the specified pin. Only a single GpioChangeCounter may be associated with a pin at any given time.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.Gpio.GpioChangeCounter.IsStarted
member.summary: Gets whether pin change counting is currently active.

member.summary: Gets or sets the polarity of transitions that will be counted. The polarity may only be changed when pin counting is not started.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cSharingMode.Exclusive
member.summary: Connects to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address exclusively, so that no other connection to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address can be made while you remain connected. This mode is the default mode.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cSharingMode.Shared

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cTransferResult
member.summary: Provides information about whether the data transfers that the ReadPartial, WritePartial, or WriteReadPartial method performed succeeded, and the actual number of bytes the method transferred.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cTransferResult.BytesTransferred
member.summary: The actual number of bytes that the operation actually transferred. The following table describes what this value represents for each method.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cTransferResult.Status
member.summary: An enumeration value that indicates if the read or write operation transferred the full number of bytes that the method requested, or the reason that the full transfer did not succeed. For WriteReadPartial, the value indicates whether the data for both the write and the read operations was entirely transferred.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cTransferStatus
member.summary: Describes whether the data transfers that the ReadPartial, WritePartial, or WriteReadPartial method performed succeeded, or provides the reason that the transfers did not succeed.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cTransferStatus.ClockStretchTimeout
member.summary: The transfer failed due to the clock being stretched for too long. Ensure the clock line is not being held low.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cTransferStatus.FullTransfer
member.summary: The data was entirely transferred. For WriteReadPartial, the data for both the write and the read operations was entirely transferred.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cTransferStatus.PartialTransfer
member.summary: The I<sup>2</sup> C device negatively acknowledged the data transfer before all of the data was transferred.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cTransferStatus.SlaveAddressNotAcknowledged
member.summary: The bus address was not acknowledged.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.I2cTransferStatus.UnknownError
member.summary: The transfer failed for an unknown reason.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cBusSpeed.FastMode
member.summary: A fast speed of 400 kHz.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cBusSpeed.StandardMode
member.summary: The standard speed of 100 kilohertz (kHz). This speed is the default.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cConnectionSettings
member.summary: Represents the connection settings you want to use for an inter-integrated circuit (I<sup>2</sup> C) device.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cConnectionSettings.BusSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the bus speed to use for connecting to an inter-integrated circuit (I<sup>2</sup> C) device. The bus speed is the frequency at which to clock the I<sup>2</sup> C bus when accessing the device.
member.returns: The bus speed to use for connecting to an I<sup>2</sup> C device.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cConnectionSettings.SharingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the sharing mode to use to connect to the inter-integrated circuit (I<sup>2</sup> C) bus address. This mode determines whether other connections to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address can be opened while you are connect to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address.
member.returns: The sharing mode to use to connect to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address.

member.name: P:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cConnectionSettings.SlaveAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the bus address of the inter-integrated circuit (I<sup>2</sup> C) device.
member.returns: The bus address of the I<sup>2</sup> C device. Only 7-bit addressing is supported, so the range of values that are valid is from 8 to 119.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cSharingMode
member.summary: Describes the modes in which you can connect to an inter-integrated circuit (I<sup>2</sup> C) bus address. These modes determine whether other connections to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address can be opened while you are connected to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cSharingMode.Exclusive
member.summary: Connects to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address exclusively, so that no other connection to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address can be made while you remain connected. This mode is the default mode.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cSharingMode.Shared
member.summary: Connects to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address in shared mode, so that other connections to the I<sup>2</sup> C bus address can be made while you remain connected.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cTransferResult
member.summary: Provides information about whether the data transfers that the ReadPartial, WritePartial, or WriteReadPartial method performed succeeded, and the actual number of bytes the method transferred.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cTransferResult.BytesTransferred
member.summary: The actual number of bytes that the operation actually transferred. The following table describes what this value represents for each method.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cTransferResult.Status
member.summary: An enumeration value that indicates if the read or write operation transferred the full number of bytes that the method requested, or the reason that the full transfer did not succeed. For WriteReadPartial, the value indicates whether the data for both the write and the read operations was entirely transferred.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cTransferStatus
member.summary: Describes whether the data transfers that the ReadPartial, WritePartial, or WriteReadPartial method performed succeeded, or provides the reason that the transfers did not succeed.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cTransferStatus.FullTransfer
member.summary: The data was entirely transferred. For WriteReadPartial, the data for both the write and the read operations was entirely transferred.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cTransferStatus.PartialTransfer
member.summary: The I<sup>2</sup> C device negatively acknowledged the data transfer before all of the data was transferred.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.I2c.Provider.ProviderI2cTransferStatus.SlaveAddressNotAcknowledged
member.summary: The bus address was not acknowledged.

member.name: T:Windows.Devices.Spi.SpiMode
member.summary: Defines the SPI communication mode. The communication mode defines the clock edge on which the master out line toggles, the master in line samples, and the signal clock's signal steady level (named SCLK). Each mode is defined with a pair of parameters called clock polarity (CPOL) and clock phase (CPHA).

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Spi.SpiMode.Mode0
member.summary: CPOL = 0, CPHA = 0.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Spi.SpiMode.Mode1
member.summary: CPOL = 0, CPHA = 1.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Spi.SpiMode.Mode2
member.summary: CPOL = 1, CPHA = 0.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Spi.SpiMode.Mode3
member.summary: CPOL = 1, CPHA = 1.

member.summary: Defines the sharing mode for the SPI bus.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Spi.SpiSharingMode.Exclusive
member.summary: SPI bus segment is not shared.

member.name: F:Windows.Devices.Spi.SpiSharingMode.Shared
member.summary: SPI bus is shared.
